programme.title: The Ashes
programme.sub-title: The Ashes: England's Best Days: Edgbaston: 2005 Second Test Day Four.
programme.desc: A look back at the fourth day of the Second Test in 2005, which was staged at Edgbaston, and saw England claim a victory by the smallest margin in Ashes history. Andrew Flintoff starred with both bat and ball as England levelled the series at 1-1, as they defeated the tourists by just two runs, in a contest remembered for Flintoff consoling Brett Lee as they sealed victory, rather than opting to celebrate.(n)

programme.title: The Ashes
programme.sub-title: The Ashes: England's Best Days: Old Trafford: 2005 Third Test Day One.
programme.desc: A look back at the opening day of the Third Test in 2005, which was staged at Old Trafford, and saw England perform well with the bat. Michael Vaughan played a captain's innings when compiling 166, the highest individual score of the series, while Marcus Trescothick chipped in with a valuable 63.(n)
